quest.name: Bully for Mochi
journal: The expectant look in the ushi bugyo's eyes can mean only one thing.

The ushi bugyo presumes correctly that you know the streets and people of Limsa Lominsa far better than him, making you an ideal assistant to deliver advent cakes to the good people of Limsa Lominsa. With Wakamaru in tow, he asks you visit select locations throughout the city-state, offering celebratory sweets to passersby.

※Please note that you will be unable to complete this quest after the seasonal event has ended. For details, please check the Lodestone.

From the head of the Fishermen's Guild to the Admiral of Limsa Lominsa herself, you come across a most unexpected and diverse assortment of people on your journey about Limsa Lominsa. Satisfied with your work, you return to the ushi bugyo with good news, and a much lighter bag of cakes.

You return to find a thankful ushi bugyo, who sees you now as an embodiment of the selfsame qualities for which the ox is honored. There is no doubt in his mind this year's Heavensturn will prove a rousing success. Indeed, there is naught left to do but relax and enjoy the revelry.
objectives: Wait at the designated locations for passersby.

dialogue.name: CUWMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: Ready to deliver advent cakes to the masses, are you? Good.

dialogue.name: CUWMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: The task shouldn't prove unduly difficult─I imagine the people will only be too happy to receive the treats. If you could take yourself to these four locations and hand them to passersby, that should suffice to spread word of our festivities.

dialogue.name: WAKAMARU
dialogue.text: Bwoo!

dialogue.name: CUWMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: And Wakamaru would accompany you once again, it would seem. Perfect. With him at your side, your intentions will be plain for all to see.

dialogue.name: CUWMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: Now then, I shan't keep you any longer. Go forth and let the good people know that Heavensturn is upon us!

dialogue.name: WAKAMARU
dialogue.text: Bwoo!

dialogue.name: CUWMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: I trust you know these streets far better than I, but I have marked four suitable locations on your map. If you should see anyone whose curiosity is piqued by the sight of Wakamaru and your advent cakes, hand them one and move on to the next.

dialogue.name: WAKAMARU
dialogue.text: Bwoo!

dialogue.name: RASHAHT
dialogue.text: [GC Rank][GC Rank][GC Rank] Surname, what a welcome surprise. In the company of a young calf... If you're working with the Far Eastern delegates, then I take it you have advent cakes. Might I trouble you for one?

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: (-???-)R'ashaht! Shouldn't you be at yer post?

dialogue.name: RASHAHT
dialogue.text: Ah! W-Well, the lieutenant was on break, you see, and...erm...

dialogue.name: RASHAHT
dialogue.text: ...Oh, it's just you, Baderon. I'll thank you not to startle me like that!

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Heh heh, apologies, Commander. I couldn't 'elp meself.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Heh. Commander...

dialogue.name: RASHAHT
dialogue.text: What is it? Have you something on your mind?

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: It's nothin', lass. It still feels strange to call ye by yer title, is all.

dialogue.name: RASHAHT
dialogue.text: What are you implying? Do you think me unworthy of my station?

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: No, no. It's just...when I look at ye, I still see the spirited young adventurer what was determined to help damn near everyone as stepped in her path.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: That kind-hearted girl's still there, mind, but she's done some growin' too. I can't think of anyone better to lead the Foreign Levy. I'm proud o' ye, lass.

dialogue.name: RASHAHT
dialogue.text: I...I don't know what to say.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Anyroad, yer handin' out them cakes, am I right? I'd be much obliged fer one.

dialogue.name: RASHAHT
dialogue.text: Ahem. If it's all the same to you, I ask that you keep that conversation private. Now, if you'll excuse me, I must return to my post.

dialogue.name: WAKAMARU
dialogue.text: Bwoo bwoo!

dialogue.name: WAKAMARU
dialogue.text: Bwoo! Bwoo bwoo!

dialogue.name: LYNGSATH
dialogue.text: What's this, now? Spreadin' a bit o' Heavensturn cheer, are ye? Hope that means ye've got advent cakes to share as well.

dialogue.name: NENEROON
dialogue.text: Lyngsath! Neneroon was not expecting such an unexpected meeting.

dialogue.name: LYNGSATH
dialogue.text: Well, well, if it ain't our trusty 'elper from last year's festival.

dialogue.name: NENEROON
dialogue.text: Neneroon helped muchly, but Lyngsath's help was much more helpful. Many readers read the Harbor Herald, and many came to taste tasty advent cakes.

dialogue.name: NENEROON
dialogue.text: Thanks to you, people found newfound respect for Qiqirns!

dialogue.name: LYNGSATH
dialogue.text: Come now, I merely gave me honest opinion o' the food. It was yer 'ard work what won folk over.

dialogue.name: NENEROON
dialogue.text: Lyngsath not credit himself with enough credit. Without your descriptive descriptions of cakes, people may never have tried them.

dialogue.name: LYNGSATH
dialogue.text: Well, anyone what appreciates a good treat would've come 'round eventually, I reckon, but I appreciate yer kind words all the same.

dialogue.name: NENEROON
dialogue.text: But enough talking talkatively! Neneroon would feast on feast of advent cake!

dialogue.name: NENEROON
dialogue.text: Hardworking people work hard to make cakes. Neneroon think of them as Neneroon chew on chewy goodness!

dialogue.name: LYNGSATH
dialogue.text: A strong sense o' duty, that one...

dialogue.name: LYNGSATH
dialogue.text: Well, I'll be off meself. Need to find a nice, quiet spot to enjoy me own morsel.

dialogue.name: WAKAMARU
dialogue.text: Bwoo!

dialogue.name: WAKAMARU
dialogue.text: Bwoo!

dialogue.name: RHOSWEN
dialogue.text: What's this, then...? Ah, right. 'Eavensturn. Let's 'ave one o' them cakes, then.

dialogue.name: RHOSWEN
dialogue.text: Actually, make it two. I know someone who'd be mighty sore to miss out.

dialogue.name: WAWALAGO
dialogue.text: Ah, if it isn't the ever-ravishing Rhoswen! Come to secure some celebratory sweets, have you?

dialogue.name: RHOSWEN
dialogue.text: W-Wawalago! The 'ells ye doin' sneakin' up on folk like that!?

dialogue.name: WAWALAGO
dialogue.text: Oho, I see you've not one, but two advent cakes. If I didn't know better, I'd say you were securing a snack for a significant someone as well!

dialogue.name: RHOSWEN
dialogue.text: Y-Ye've got it all wrong. I-I'm feelin' famished, see, an' one cake wouldn't be enough to satisfy me...

dialogue.name: WAWALAGO
dialogue.text: Is that right? And there I was boldly believing that one was bound for Carvallain!

dialogue.name: RHOSWEN
dialogue.text: N-Now ye listen 'ere! Ye say any more, an' I'll cut off yer blabbin' tongue─debts be damned!

dialogue.name: WAWALAGO
dialogue.text: <sigh> Still fast to fly into a fury, I see... Small wonder you can't reel in a romantic rendezvous.

dialogue.name: RHOSWEN
dialogue.text: Hmph! I'm leader o' the Sanguine Sirens. I've no interest in such nonsense!

dialogue.name: WAWALAGO
dialogue.text: Such senseless stubbornness... If she's not true to her feelings, she'll never catch the fish she fancies.

dialogue.name: CARVALLAIN
dialogue.text: What have we here? A calf? Ah, but of course─Heavensturn. You must be distributing advent cakes. If you have some left, I should like to have one.

dialogue.name: WAWALAGO
dialogue.text: W-Wait, Carvallain. Someone has already come to collect a cake on your behalf.

dialogue.name: CARVALLAIN
dialogue.text: On my behalf? I do not recall giving such an order to my crew.

dialogue.name: CARVALLAIN
dialogue.text: Well, if it should transpire that they had the forethought to procure one in my stead, then all well and good. But until such time as this is known─a cake, if you please.

dialogue.name: WAWALAGO
dialogue.text: Oh dear. A situation as sticky─though nowhere near as scrumptious─as the cakes. Speaking of which...may I have one too?

dialogue.name: WAKAMARU
dialogue.text: Bwoo...

dialogue.name: WAKAMARU
dialogue.text: Bwoo!

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: Just when I thought I heard a peculiar lowing... Brithael, come see! They're handing out advent cakes!

dialogue.name: BRITHAEL
dialogue.text: Cake...? I'm afraid my stomach couldn't handle it right now...

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: And there I was thinking your condition had improved.

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: At any rate, might I trouble you for two? One for me, and another for when his stomach's more agreeable.

dialogue.name: MERWYB
dialogue.text: (-???-)I would have one as well, if I may.

dialogue.name: BRITHAEL
dialogue.text: A-Admiral!?

dialogue.name: MERWYB
dialogue.text: Well, well, if it isn't my esteemed guildmasters. Come to partake of advent cakes as well, have you?

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: We have. We weren't aware you were fond of them too, Admiral.

dialogue.name: BRITHAEL
dialogue.text: Aye. An' busy as ye are, I thought ye would've sent someone to collect in yer stead.

dialogue.name: MERWYB
dialogue.text: These advent cakes are said to bring one good fortune, are they not? I cannot well imagine good fortune would favor those unwilling to make an effort to personally receive it.

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: A sentiment with which we can relate, Admiral. The gods know we crafting folk are a superstitious lot.

dialogue.name: BRITHAEL
dialogue.text: Aye, an' cakes aside, I've to say that just bein' out here amidst the festivities is doin' me good. My head feels clearer already.

dialogue.name: MERWYB
dialogue.text: I'm glad to hear it.

dialogue.name: MERWYB
dialogue.text: I too enjoy the opportunity to be out here alone, just another citizen, without an armed escort. Marshal Slafyrsyn will have a thing or two to say afterwards, but it is worth it.

dialogue.name: MERWYB
dialogue.text: Now then, if you would be so kind...

dialogue.name: MERWYB
dialogue.text: My thanks. And now, to find a quiet place to enjoy this in peace.

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: We should be taking our leave as well. Thank you again for the cake.

dialogue.name: WAKAMARU
dialogue.text: Bwoo, bwoo!

dialogue.name: CUWMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: Ah, you are returned, and with far fewer cakes than when you left!

dialogue.name: CUWMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: In the Far East, it is said the ushi is the embodiment of honest and hard work─qualities which I see are shared by the adventurers of this land.

dialogue.name: CUWMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: I have no doubt this year's Heavensturn will be a rousing success, thanks in no small part to you.

dialogue.name: WAKAMARU
dialogue.text: Bwoo! Bwoo!
